title: Harpers Ferry National Historical Park: Park Home
body: Step Back in Time  A visit to this quaint, historic community, at the confluence of the Potomac and Shenandoah rivers, is like stepping into the past.  Stroll the picturesque streets, visit exhibits and museums, or hike our trails and battlefields. Spend a day or a weekend.  We have something for everyone, so come and discover Harpers Ferry!                Hike Harpers Ferry!   Hike one of the park's trails to enjoy history and nature while in the outdoors! Trail difficulty ranges from easy to strenuous.        Special Events and Ranger Programs   Check out the special events and ranger programs that Harpers Ferry NHP has to offer!        Historic Trades Workshops   Learn more about our historic trades workshops and register for one of these unique opportunities!            Join us for The Confluence on August 20   Join us where the rivers meet. The Confluence Festival will celebrate music and arts related to Harpers Ferry. August 20, 2016 - 11am-8pm            Volunteer today!   Harpers Ferry has many volunteer opportunities ranging from one day park clean-up events to assisting at the Visitor Center.        Be an Intern!   We offer internships in several departments in the park - education, living history, social media, natural resources, and many more!
